articles.title: Caitlin Clark joins Lynette Woodard, Pearl Moore as scoring champion - NPR
articles.description: The scoring records of two Black American college basketball stars from the 1970s and 1980s are overlooked by the NCAA as Caitlin Clark takes the mantle as women's scoring champion.
articles.content:
Lynette Woodard, pictured circa 1990, scored 3,649 points for the University of Kansas and went on to play professionally and for Team USA.
Tony Duffy/Getty Images
All eyes were on Caitlin Clark as… [+4368 chars]
